title: AI Engineer
description:

VI S√ñKER DIG SOM 
- Educational background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, or a related field

- Strong proficiency in Python
- Understanding of LLM & Agentic systems
- Documented experience developing and integrating REST APIs

It is meritorious if you have


* A portfolio demonstrating practical Python skills (e.g., own applications, tools, or interfaces)
* Experience with frameworks like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or Semantic Kernel
* Knowledge of Data Engineering (ETL processes and data pipelines)
* Experience working in a Linux environment
* Engagement in developer communities or contributions to open-source projects


To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:


* Supportive
* Goal oriented
* Social
* Responsible


Our recruitment process

This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client‚Äôs wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.

Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.

title: Expert in Applied AI for Materials and Manufacturing
company: RISE Research Institutes of Sweden AB
description:
A better world requires new perspectives enabled by new knowledge, new technologies, and strong forces that bring them together. RISE, Sweden‚Äôs independent research institute and innovation partner, serves as such a force by connecting research excellence with industrial and societal impact.
RISE is now establishing MIMER-Sweden‚Äôs national AI Factory, a European hub for AI research, advanced infrastructure, and large-scale adoption. Mimer will strengthen Sweden‚Äôs and Europe‚Äôs capacity to develop and deploy AI responsibly across strategic application areas.
In this context, RISE is expanding its activities at the intersection of Applied AI and Materials Science. AI-driven methods are rapidly transforming how materials and production processes are developed, enabling faster, more sustainable, and more data-driven innovation.
About us The position is based at the Division of Materials and Production (MoP) and the Department of Manufacturing and Production Transition, where applied research and close collaboration with industry are central to developing impactful materials and manufacturing solutions. The division works across the full innovation chain, from fundamental understanding to industrial implementation. The role is carried out in close collaboration with RISE‚Äôs Division of Computer Science, comprising around 100 experts with leading competence in core digital technologies, including AI, cybersecurity, 5G/Edge, IoT, advanced data analytics, and software and data center technologies.
The position is connected to Mimer, one of 19 European AI Factories within the EuroHPC framework. Mimer brings together more than 25 colleagues from RISE across multiple units and roles including researchers, business developers, and communicators working jointly to strengthen industrial competitiveness and innovation in Sweden and across Europe. Together, these capabilities are at the forefront of the digital transformation of industry and society and are critical to Sweden‚Äôs long-term competitiveness.
About the position This position is central to Mimer‚Äôs mission to enable organizations to apply modern AI efficiently, responsibly, and at scale. You will work hands-on with users and partners to address real-world challenges, develop applied AI solutions, and make advanced AI and HPC infrastructure accessible.
The role can be described as an AI deployment oriented position, operating at the interface between research, engineering, and industrial use. You will collaborate closely with researchers, engineers, SMEs, and companies, translating needs into technical solutions ranging from rapid prototypes to production-ready workflows. This includes developing reusable tools, pipelines, and components that support broad AI adoption.
You will work with state-of-the-art AI methods, including large language models, agent-based systems, computer vision, multimodal models, generative AI, and physics-based and physics-informed machine learning (PhyML). A key part of the role is supporting users as they transition from experimentation to deployment, including onboarding partners to Mimer‚Äôs secure AI and HPC infrastructure.
Your involvement in Mimer also includes contributions to training, workshops, knowledge transfer, and community-building activities in Sweden and across Europe. You will collaborate closely with colleagues in areas such as trustworthy AI, software engineering, HPC, data management, and domain-specific teams, and contribute to Europe-wide AI Factory activities.
In addition, part of the role will be dedicated to applied research within Department of Manufacturing and Production Transition, focusing on manufacturing and materials-related challenges. This includes research in forming, casting, additive manufacturing, and fundamental materials research, where AI and data-driven methods are applied to improve processes, material performance, and sustainability.
The position is based at the Division of MoP and the Department of Manufacturing and Production Transition in M√∂lndal.
Who You Are We are looking for strong applied AI practitioners who enjoy working directly with users and solving real-world problems professionals who combine technical depth with practical execution.
Required qualifications:

PhD in materials science or a closely related field, with solid experience in machine learning and/or AI engineering


Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with modern software engineering practices


Experience building or adapting AI models, pipelines, APIs, or tools


Understanding of data pipelines, model evaluation, and scalable deployment


Experience from industry, research labs, consultancy, or applied research environments


Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work across diverse teams in a high-paced environment


Excellent communication skills in English


Meritorious

Experience with GPU computing, distributed training, or HPC environments


Experience with MLOps and automation tools (e.g. Kubernetes, Kubeflow, MLflow, Airflow, Argo)


Experience with modern AI training frameworks (e.g. DeepSpeed, Hugging Face Accelerate)


Experience leading or coordinating technical tasks or small projects


Swedish language skills


You are a curious, pragmatic, and impact-driven individual who enjoys working across organizations and sectors. You thrive in collaborative environments while being able to work independently in complex and evolving contexts. Above all, you are motivated by using AI to address meaningful challenges and create positive societal impact across Sweden and Europe.
Application If you would like to know more, please contact Thor Wikfeldt (+46 10 228 46 79), Daniel Wiklund (+46 10 228 48 33) or Erdzan Hodzic (+46 10 228 44 33).
The application deadline is Mars 15. Apply without a cover letter. Selection and interviews will take place continuously during and after the application period.
Union representatives: Ingemar Petermann, SACO, +46 10 228 41 22 Linda Ikatti, Unionen, +46 10 516 51 61

title: Engagement Manager
description:
We believe that everything starts with learning. And that by changing the way the world learns, we can change the world for the better. If that‚Äôs a mission that excites you, you‚Äôll be in great company at Sana owned by Workday. 
We‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionise how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing, from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google, have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity‚Äôs most critical challenges. 
Our Impact team is known for its adaptability, entrepreneurial spirit, and relentless pursuit of excellence, embodying our core belief that learning is the foundation of all meaningful change. We work very closely with the companies who choose Sana: together we problem solve, design solutions, and implement them to drive real change. Ultimately, we measure ourselves by the impact we achieve through rolling out and adopting Sana across our customers‚Äô organisations. By scaling this team, we shape the future of Sana‚Äôs customer success, solution engineering, and deployments functions, and create a significant impact on how people learn across every industry and across the globe.
About the Role
As an Engagement Manager, you are the senior owner of some of Sana‚Äôs most strategic customer engagements. You lead complex, multi-phase implementations and drive long-term value realisation for our enterprise customers. You act as the primary point of accountability for the overall success of the engagement: from discovery and solution design, through deployment and change management, to adoption, expansion, and measurable business impact.
You will orchestrate cross-functional teams (product, solutions, CS, data, partners) and engage with senior customer stakeholders to ensure Sana‚Äôs solutions are aligned with their strategic priorities. You combine strong project and program management discipline with a consultative mindset and commercial awareness, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope and budget, while uncovering opportunities to deepen and expand the partnership.
Key Role Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Own end-to-end customer engagements
Serve as the overall engagement owner for assigned accounts, accountable for successful implementation and ongoing value realisation.
Lead complex deployments of Sana for medium and large enterprise customers, from discovery and design through go-live and post-launch optimisation.

‚Ä¢ Lead project and program delivery
Define and manage project scope, plan, timelines, risks, and dependencies across multiple work streams.
Ensure delivery within the budget and scope outlined in the Statement of Work, proactively managing changes and trade-offs.
Coordinate internal Sana resources and external partners to deliver against project objectives.

‚Ä¢ Engage senior customer stakeholders
Build and maintain trusted advisor relationships with executive sponsors and key decision makers.
Facilitate steering committees and executive readouts, clearly articulating progress, risks, and business impact.
Align Sana‚Äôs roadmap and capabilities with the customer‚Äôs strategic priorities and success metrics.

‚Ä¢ Drive adoption and measurable impact
Define, track, and report on success metrics and KPIs for each engagement.
Work closely with customer project managers and business owners to promote adoption, ensure change readiness, and drive continuous improvement.
Identify optimisation and expansion opportunities that increase the value customers realise from Sana.

‚Ä¢ Provide strategic and solution guidance
Translate business requirements into solution designs and implementation plans in collaboration with Solution Engineering and Product.
Advise customers on best practices for learning, change management, and digital adoption, leveraging Sana‚Äôs capabilities.
Challenge and refine customer requirements where needed to ensure viable, scalable, and high-impact solutions.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate cross-functionally and with partners
Work effectively with Sales to scope new engagements, shape proposals, and ensure a smooth transition from pre‚Äësales to delivery.
Manage third-party partners or vendors as part of the overall project team, maintaining accountability for overall outcomes.
Provide structured feedback to Product and Engineering based on customer needs and deployment learnings.



Basic Qualification: 
1-3 years of progressively responsible experience in Enterprise software implementation, management consulting, or customer success / professional services roles.
Minimum Educational Requirement Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or foreign equivalent) in Business, Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related field.
A Master‚Äôs degree in a related field is preferred but not required. In lieu of a bachelor‚Äôs degree, the employer will accept an equivalent combination of education and progressively responsible experience.
Fluency in English is mandatory; additional languages are a plus.



Other Qualifications: 
Are naturally curious, always seeking to learn, and view every challenge as a growth opportunity.
Have strong project and program management skills, with a solid track record leading complex implementations in a Professional Services or Customer Success environment.
Are comfortable engaging with C‚Äëlevel and senior stakeholders, with excellent communication and presentation skills.
Possess grit and determination, allowing you to weather setbacks and persist towards ambitious goals.
Are driven by excellence and high standards in planning, execution, and stakeholder management.
Embody humbleness and a collaborative mindset, always ready to learn from others and co‚Äëcreate solutions.
Are deeply committed to our mission of changing the way the world learns and have a genuine passion for driving customer impact.
Are strong at building relationships, working cross-functionally, and influencing internal and external stakeholders.
Can manage multiple priorities and engagements in parallel, maintaining structure and clarity for all parties involved.
Promote a positive and inclusive working environment and contribute to the culture of the Impact team.
Have international and/or cross-cultural experience and are comfortable working with global customers.

title: Lead Architect - Safety & Digital applications, Operate
description:
Epiroc is a leading productivity partner for the mining, infrastructure and natural resources industries.
Learn more at www.epirocgroup.com.

Our cool digital products within Operates segment for Production management, Asset tracking and Asset health helps our customers to a safer and more successful production in the mine.¬† We are a global team with colleagues in √ñrebro, Lule√•, Chile, Canada and India that collaborates closely.
Your mission
As Lead Architect for Safety& Digital Applications, Operate, you will guide and coordinate the architectural and technology direction for current and future products within the Operate segment.

You will work closely with Tech Leads in your closest team, development teams, product managers, and other architects across Digital Solutions and Epiroc IT.
Your role is to secure a holistic and long‚Äëterm architectural vision‚Äîcovering enterprise, data, solution, and infrastructure architecture‚Äîensuring alignment, quality, cybersecurity, and compliance. You will lead decisions around integrations, data flows, event‚Äëdriven architecture, and technical frameworks, as well as support teams with documentation and architectural processes.
A key part of your mission is to be a technology evangelist: scouting new trends, exploring AI‚Äëdriven opportunities, running proofs‚Äëof‚Äëconcept, and inspiring teams to adopt modern, future‚Äëproof technologies. You will help consolidate technologies, drive efficiency, and represent Operate in architectural forums and cross‚Äëorganizational collaborations.

Your profile

Proven leadership experience‚Äîable to guide, empower, influence, and align teams in a collaborative and supportive way. Curious mindset with a passion for exploring new technologies, AI trends, and modern architectural approaches.
Experience driving architectural strategies, long‚Äëterm technical visions, and complex solution designs. Ability to balance hands‚Äëon technical support with high‚Äëlevel strategic thinking. Strong personality who brings energy, structure, and clarity‚Äîsomeone who inspires others, not someone who simply follows established patterns.
Enjoys working with multidisciplinary teams and has the ability to build alignment across roles and organizational boundaries. Comfortable leading discussions around frameworks, quality, cybersecurity, compliance, and architectural governance.¬†Fluent in English
Location and other
This position is located in¬†√ñrebro or Lule√•, Sweden.

title: Deep Learning Engineer
description:
About Embedl
Embedl is a fast-growing technology start-up based in Gothenburg, Sweden. With a team of almost 30 dedicated professionals, we are on a mission to make AI affordable and efficient in embedded systems. Our development team is headquartered in Gothenburg, and our innovative solutions serve customers all over the world. We maintain close connections with academic research institutions, industry leaders, and the innovation ecosystem, supported by strong relationships with venture capital partners.
The Role
As Deep Learning Engineer, you own the last mile between state-of-the-art models and the silicon that runs them. Your mission is to integrate, optimize, and profile the capabilities of Embedl‚Äôs SDK on a widening spectrum of edge accelerators.
Responsibilities
Build & maintain inference backends for the Embedl SDK's growing set of supported edge accelerators including NVIDIA TensorRT, Qualcomm QNN, Ambarella ADK, Texas Instruments TIDL, etc.


Continuously track the state of the art in embedded-AI workflows. Distill the best compiler flags, memory layouts, and optimization tricks, and share them across our engineering and research teams.


Profile, benchmark, and resolve bottleneck in models. Pinpoint performance hot-spots, then deliver targeted optimizations that turn good benchmarks into great real-world latency and power figures.


Extend Embedl‚Äôs model-optimization capabilities. Sparsity, quantization, and more works on an ever-broader range of neural-network architectures and hardware platforms.

Who You Are
An engineer comfortable reasoning at every layer ‚Äî from high-level neural-network graphs down to low-level instructions. You thrive on unraveling the hardware details that turn good models into great products.



Qualifications
Must-Have
B.Sc./M.Sc. in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent hands-on experience.


Demonstrated success in porting or optimizing deep-learning inference on at least one accelerator family (e.g., Qualcomm, TI, NVIDIA Jetson, ARM Ethos-U/NPU).


3+ years of experience in C/C++ and Python for tooling and automation.

title: Legal Counsel to Expansion Legal Team - Temporary Position
company: H & M Hennes & Mauritz Gbc AB
description:
Company Description
WHO WE ARE
H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
We are looking for an Interim Legal Counsel to join the Expansion Legal Team in Stockholm for one year with start date in March or April.


Job Description
WHAT YOU WILL DO
As Legal Counsel in the Expansion Legal Team, you will play a pivotal role in defining and executing the strategic legal agenda across our global store portfolio in over 70 different markets. You will work with global and regional stakeholders to align commercial requirements with global legal standards and safeguard these in our contracts. Acting as a global centre of excellence, you will partner with local market counsels to foster best practices across regions, ensuring consistency and compliance with the strategies you help define for each region. Additionally, you will lead training and knowledge-sharing initiatives to strengthen legal capabilities and champion AI and tech-enabled solutions to streamline processes and enhance efficiency.
This role offers a broad global scope, providing opportunities to drive impactful initiatives and contribute to significant business outcomes. 
Your main responsibilities include but are not limited to: 
Legal Advisory and Contract Management: 
Provide expert legal advice and guidance to the Commercial Expansion team, offering insights on a diverse array of issues associated with international expansion.  
Identify and assess legal risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. 
Navigate regulatory landscapes and ensure compliance with laws, regulations, and standards impacting the retail industry. 
Develop, review, support in negotiations and negotiate a comprehensive range of commercial tenancy contracts essential for expansion initiatives, such as lease agreements, amendments, revenue sharing agreements etc.  
Ensure that contractual arrangements entered at a market level align with the H&M Groups‚Äô strategic objectives and legal requirements.  
Oversee and provide support in local litigations and legal proceedings by providing strategic advice to the local legal teams. 
 

Legal Operations and Corporate Governance: 
Foster collaborative relationships with various departments, advise and support them and help set up ways of working where required to streamline contract negotiation, signing and enhance operational efficiency.  
Ensure seamless integration of legal considerations into the broader expansion strategy through coaching and training market counsels and being their point of contact at Head Office. 
Develop and maintain systems for managing legal documentation, contracts and information.  
Ensure correct representation of deals to the board or decision-makers.  
Oversee the proper execution of documents.  
Lead and support with the implementation of centrally driven key projects, including legal AI and tech initiatives, across our markets.  

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH  
As a Legal Counsel in the Expansion Legal Team, you will belong to the Expansion‚ÄØDepartment at‚ÄØCommercial Development & Growth. 
Commercial Development & Growth is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission to set and deliver on the global customer experience strategy to strengthen the brand and enable profitable sales. The function develops, expands and optimises all sales channels while securing conditions for efficient operations leveraged by tech and strong collaboration across the organisation.
The Expansion Department owns the inorganic omni growth strategies, drives leasing, portfolio management and partner strategies in our 70+ markets. In this role, you will collaborate closely with both global and regional stakeholders.


Qualifications
WHO YOU ARE
We are looking for people with:
A law degree.  
5 ‚Äì 10 years of legal experience, preferably within real estate.  

And people who have:
Exceptional communication skills, required for interactions with markets, cross functional teams, Global Landlords and senior stakeholders.  
Understanding of risk assessment and ability to communicate associated consequences to decision makers in a simple and straight forward way.  
Proficiency in conflict resolution, especially in situations with conflicting interests.  
Comfortable with decision-making, even in ambiguous circumstances and tight timelines.  
Ability to undertake a thorough review of contracts and agreements.  
Analytical skills for breaking down arguments or theories, conceptualizing ideas, and providing well-supported conclusions. 
Prioritization skills to identify and focus on key goals and tasks.  
Strategic thinking in defining and implementing effective long-term plans in line with the vision and strategy of the legal team.  
Strong interest in leveraging technology and digital tools, including legal AI solutions, to enhance efficiency and quality in legal work. 
Capability to plan and timely execute projects that span across multiple regions. 

 
Additional Information
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
This is a full-time temporary position for 1 year, commencing on March or April, 2026. You will report to Head of Expansion Legal.


If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your resume in English (no need for cover letter) by February 15th, 2026. We will review applications and conduct interviews continuously, so send in your application today! We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Software Developer - Partner Innovation, Lund
description:
Axis has a strong network of partners who develop creative software solutions on top of our strong hardware and software portfolio. The mission of our Developer Success team within R&D is to work both operationally and strategically to make these partners successful.

We are now looking for an experienced software engineer to join this talented and creative team. You will be a link between R&D teams who provide APIs (both on-device and in cloud) and external development partners who build solutions upon these APIs.

What you'll do here day-to-day:

 * Work directly with pilot partners to bring new API functionality to market - showcase Axis offering and help the partner make it work for them
 * Educate and train other Axis functions (e.g. sales-focused roles) on API offerings to scale these offerings beyond pilot partners
 * Evaluate new API functionality and provide feedback to R&D teams from the perspective of an external developer
 * Identify gaps in Axis offer to developers and work with other R&D teams to make sure these gaps get filled
 * Create content that can help external developers: blog posts, videos, demo applications and similar
 * Think strategically about developer support - how to make a broad range of partners successful with a low-touch effort

Who are we looking for?

 * You are a developer at heart; coding is a natural way for you to solve problems - both at work and in your personal life
 * You have a proactive, can-do attitude
 * You get energized by solving problems, helping others, and bringing new ideas to fruition
 * You are an excellent communicator who can explain complex topics to both developers and business-focused roles
 * You are curious about new technology, and you are eager to try out and embrace new tools, for example in the AI space

We'd love to hear that you have

 * A strong technical background as a professional software engineer, including hands-on experience with multiple of the following technologies: 

 * API Proficiency: Strong experience with GraphQL (querying, mutations) and REST APIs. Familiarity with VAPIX is a strong plus.
 * Video Streaming Expertise: Understanding of video protocols, specifically WebRTC signaling flows, STUN/TURN servers, and RTSP.
 * Cloud & Identity Security: Hands-on experience with modern authentication standards, specifically OAuth 2.0(OpenID Connect) and JWT flows.
 * Edge/Hybrid Computing: Understanding of the trade-offs between edge processing (bandwidth saving) vs. cloud processing (compute power).
 * Development Experience: Ability to read/write code examples (Python, JavaScript, etc.) to assist partners with API integrations.

 *  A university degree in engineering or computer science, or similar experience

It is a bonus if you also have prior experience with

 * Axis technology and product portfolio
 * Working in a market-facing role, such as Technical Support Engineer, Sales Engineer, Product Specialist or similar

What Axis have to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you'll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance - developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You'll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.

Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal "fika" chats, formal meetings, or after-hours activities. Check it out: Axis HQ

Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance - and even your own Axis bicycle.

To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis

Ready to Act?

title: Project Manager
description:

title: Senior Gameplay Programmer
description:
If you‚Äôre looking to make the best co-op games in the world, you‚Äôve come to the right place. We're proud to have some of the best game makers and collaborators in the industry working with us. What's more, we're a fun bunch of game developers, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together. Our games are not for everyone. Are they for you? 
We are now looking for a Senior Gameplay Programmer

We‚Äôre expanding our gameplay programming team and looking for an experienced developer who cares about writing clean, performant, and maintainable code, and who wants to support those around them.
You‚Äôll be joining a collaborative team of engineers, designers, and artists who enjoy solving complex problems together. We‚Äôre not just looking for someone who can write code ‚Äî we‚Äôre looking for someone who can shape systems, guide teammates, and balance clarity, performance, and creativity in everything they do.
We use a heavily customized version of Stingray, and our development is primarily in C++. The focus is on building gameplay systems that are reliable, scalable, and performant; particularly for multiplayer and live service environments. This is a hands-on role with plenty of room to take ownership and work on how our features and systems evolve.
What you‚Äôll do
Design, implement, and maintain gameplay systems and features in C++.


Build dynamic systems that interact in overlapping, emergent ways.


Write gameplay code that is clean, scalable, and performance-aware.


Profile and optimize systems to keep frame time, memory, and networking stable.


Debug complex gameplay issues, from multi-system interactions to edge cases.


Collaborate with design, QA, and production to ensure features deliver both technically and for players.


Help maintain consistent standards through code reviews, discussions, and technical guidance.


Contribute to a healthy, collaborative team culture by sharing knowledge and supporting peers.


Act as a point of clarity in design and implementation, supporting alignment across the team.


Work with industry-standard tools for production tracking (e.g., Jira, Confluence) to keep work transparent and traceable.


Write and maintain documentation that makes systems, workflows, and decisions clear to the team.

What we‚Äôre looking for
Excellent C++ skills and deep experience in a game engine context.


5+ years of hands-on experience developing gameplay features and systems, especially for multiplayer games (shooters a strong plus).


Strong understanding of CPU architecture, memory, and performance trade-offs ‚Äî able to explain concepts like CPU caches and their impact on real-world code.


Ability to create gameplay systems that support emergent interactions.


Familiarity with a broad range of development areas: gameplay, content creation, physics, animation, AI, and systems integration.


Strong foundation in 3D math (linear algebra, vectors, matrices).


One or more shipped titles in a C++ environment (custom engine or Unreal).


Experience with live service development and maintaining code post-launch.


Fluency in written and spoken English.

Nice-to-have (but not required)
Familiarity with ECS architectures.


Experience building developer tools or improving workflows.


Experience shipping on consoles like PS4/PS5 or Xbox Series X|S.


Comfortable with Git and modern development practices.

You‚Äôll be a great fit if‚Ä¶ 
You enjoy solving hard problems and sharing what you learn.


You care about writing maintainable code that others can understand and extend.


You‚Äôre collaborative, supportive, and open to feedback ‚Äî and you give it kindly too.


You‚Äôre curious, practical, and like to keep things relaxed but focused.

How to apply
If you think that this position matches your background and skills, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your CV in English as soon as possible.¬†We ask that your application always include relevant work samples or a link to your portfolio.
We interview candidates continuously and hire when we find a good fit. 
Practical Information
Scope: Full-time: 40 hours per week with initial 6 month probation period. Location: Office first, hybrid solution possible.¬†You need to be eligible to work in Sweden. 
We are a pet friendly office! You can expect to find dogs and occasionally some cats around.  
What we offer
Arrowhead Game Studios is a growing team of about 100+ people, best known for our co-op titles. Despite our size, we remain a friendly and down to earth bunch, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together.
Located in a newly built, custom-tailored offices on the Hammarby Kaj waterfront, we enjoy everything Stockholm has to offer. A thriving game dev scene, along with all types of activities are immediately available on our doorstep.
Our talented developers are crucial to our success, therefore we put a lot of emphasis in creating and maintaining a prosperous culture. We‚Äôre committed to open and transparent communication. Your ideas are welcomed, valued, appreciated - the ceiling for creative discussions is high.
We also have numerous work benefits for all our employees. You can read about them here!

title: Material Planning Manager, ABB Robotics
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we‚Äôll give you what you need to make it happen. It won‚Äôt always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you‚Äôll never run alone. Run what runs the world.
This role sits within ABB's Robotics business, a leading global robotics company. We're entering an exciting new chapter as we‚Äôve announced the plan for SoftBank Group to acquire ABB Robotics. SoftBank is a globally recognized technology group and investor/operator focused on AI, robotics, and next-generation computing.  By joining us now, you‚Äôll be part of a pioneering team shaping the future of robotics‚Äîworking alongside world-class experts in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment.
This Position reports to: Local SCM Manager Robotics Sweden. 
Are you ready to shape the future of robotics and advanced manufacturing? At ABB Robotics, you will join a global technology leader driving the next wave of industrial transformation. Our V√§ster√•s site is the heart of our European robotics production‚Äîwhere innovation, collaboration, and operational excellence come together to serve customers across the globe. 
We are now looking for our next Material Planning Manager, a key leadership role responsible for securing material availability in our European factory located in V√§ster√•s. Together with the team and our global supplier base you will drive excellence in supply planning, inventory optimization, and supplier collaboration to ensure smooth production flow and high on-time delivery (OTD) to our customers.  
As a professional you are result-oriented, have strong communication skills and thrive in a fast-paced and international environment. You will report to the Local Supply Chain Manager in Sweden and be based in V√§ster√•s.  
Responsibilities 
Ensure material availability and on-time delivery from our supplier base to the factory in V√§ster√•s, proactively managing risks and resolving deviations in demand and supply. 
You will be first line manager for a team with approx. 10 employees located in Sweden and second line manager for a team of approx. 10 employees located in Estonia. 
Provide visibility of supply capacity and local supply objectives into the Sales and Operations Planning process. 
Manage and develop inventory strategies to optimize balance between material availability, flexibility and inventory turnover. 
Drive continuous improvement in supplier performance, planning processes, and cross-functional collaboration.  

Qualifications for the role 
Proven experience in purchasing, supply chain or related fields from a manufacturing industry is required; Management experience is a strong plus. 
You are result-oriented, analytical, action-oriented with strong communication skills. 
You have a passion for managing external business relationships and negotiations in a global context. 
Proficiency in Excel (or other similar tools) and working knowledge of SAP. 
University degree in supply chain, logistics, engineering, economics or quality is preferred. 
Swedish and English is mandatory and highly necessary for this position, along with great verbal and written communication skills. 

What's in it for you? 
We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You‚Äôll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that‚Äôs tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger. 
From well-being to retirement, ABB offers benefits that support every stage of your career. 
More about us 
Recruiting Manager: Lina Heybroek. Union representatives ‚Äì Sveriges Ingenj√∂rer: Pia Sandstr√∂m, +4672 525 90 30; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson, +46 730 30 30 36. Talent Partner: Ludvig Ahlqvist. 
We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is: February 23th.  
We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.
